title: MAILS FREE
creator: nadetted
content:
Bonjour Désolée, je ne sais pas écrire en Anglais, mais je pose ma question ici, au cas où une bonne âme pourrait m'aider. Je suis nulle en informatique, le minimum... -Mon mail ' nadetted@free.fr ' a basculé sur ZIMBRA, et je n'aime pas du tout fonctionner avec. 

                 Les 2 adresses mails sont les mêmes, et je me perds dans les mots de passe.

-Sur l'ordi, mes mails vont jusqu'au 29 novembre ? .et on me demande "Saisissez votre mot de passe pour nadetted sur imap.free.fr : *alors que je n'en ai jamais mis, et accédais direct à mes mails.

-Ensuite j'ai cela  :: "échec de la connexion depuis le serveur imap.free.fr avec le nom d’utilisateur nadetted" 

                                 *le serveur IMAP .free serait déconnecté !?

-Sur le GSM, je vois mes mailsl jusqu'au 15 décembre 2025 ?  !

-J'arrive à voir mes mails sur Zimbra, mais je voudrais sortir de là et récupérer *sans pertes de dossiers etc, ma boîte mail d'avant  :: nadetted@free.fr classique, que j'ai depuis très longtemps. Cela est-il possible SVP ? -Depuis, j'ai de gros soucis de connexion avec mes contacts et RV médicaux, nous sommes des personnes âgées, et personne pour nous conseiller. Je pense à un Bug, ou une mise à jour défaillante ? Je suis en W10

-J'espère que quelqu'un pourra me lire, voir me contacter en Français, sur mon mail de secours : [edited from public] @laposte.net ou [edited from public community support forum] @free.fr Bien à vous Merci Mme Benard France

title: Problemas para importar calendario de Outlook a Thunderbird
creator: josanmu52
content:
Hola a tod@s. Llevo tiempo trasteando con Thunderbird, con la finalidad de centralizar ahí, mis tres cuentas de correo en Gmail, Outlook y Proton. Finalmente, las cuentas de correo he conseguido importarlas, y también los contactos. Sin embargo, con el calendario de Outlook, que es el que utilizo como agenda, no hay manera de conseguirlo. Como podéis ver, la importación se realiza, pero en un 40% de los eventos, ha sustituido el título que yo les había asignado y en todos ellos aparece como "Cita privada". Agradeceré la ayuda de cualquiera que lo haya conseguido y no le importe echarme una mano.

Gracias.

Un saludo.

title: Thunderbird calendar and task issue
creator: bill.ditwell
content: I have been using ThunderBird on Linux Mint for some time now. I am using Outlook.com for emails, calendar and contacts and I sync with another laptop and mobile phone. All fine until a few days ago when I noticed calendar events were not syncing with my phone. I found one calendar event in ThunderBird had an error when I manually synced with TbSync. The error report did not say anything specific. I deleted this calendar event and TbSync ran successfully uploading 2 events that it had not uploaded due to the calendar sync error. I then wanted to manually recreate this calendar event in ThunderBird. When I clicked on "New Event", the Calendar New Event pop-up window did not appear. When I minimised the ThunderBird window, the New Events was not behind it. The ThunderBird icon pinned to the panel had a "2" in the corner. When I hovered over the ThunderBird icon in the panel, it showed both the ThunderBird window and New Event window preview. When I selected the New Event preview window in the panel, it still did not become visible. All I could do with with New Event preview window in the panel was click in the 'X' to close it. I checked for Lightning Calendar Tab add-on updates. It was up to date. I check the settings. All OK. I disabled and enabled this add-on. Still not working. My Windows habits made me shutdown and restart my device. Still Not working. When I checked the other ThunderBird functions, New Event pop-up windows appeared for Emails and Contacts but not Tasks which had the same symptoms as the Calendar.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;os:Linux Mint 22.3;solver_id:7245276

content:
I'm trying to find the proper way to revert back to the default location for local mail message storage in TB (ver 140.7.1 esr).

I have many years and about 13Gb of email messages that I want to ensure I keep.

TIA

title: Seems impossible to transfer data from Windows 10 140.7.1esr (32 bit) to W11 140.7.1esr (64 bit)
creator: larrybreese
content:
Hello all:

Transferring Thunderbird from the system above to the system noted above. Follow the instructions from here on the Mozilla Support page (copied both "Thunderbird" directories into the Roaming and Local destination directories. When the destination machine installation opens, it is functional (i.e. it picks up all the existing e-mail accounts, downloads new mail, etc...). The problem starts when we get to the local folders.

All of these have a date and time appended to them in the destination installation. For example, if the original folder is "Prosperity Bank" the destination folder is labeled "Prosperity Bank (2025_09_21 23_06_33 UTC)" and will not let not populate (shows no messages inside).

As I am typing this, it seems I may have identified the problem (or at least part of it). It seems the destination system install is slowly working its way through the local folders randomly (not in alphabetically order), as it seems to be slowly populating them with the old mail stored therein on the original system. It is going very slowly. Very slowly.

Has anyone else experienced this? Is it normal? Is there any way to quickly eliminate the dates now appended to the local file names? (Visually this is very annoying and I do not want to try modifying the individual folder names yet until I'm sure its populated as much as it will populate.)

Thank you for any assistance.

Larry Reese
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer"]

title: Adding new account
creator: wpjohns
content:
I am setting up a new computer with Linux Mint and Thunderbird. I got my primary comcast.net account added in and working but when trying to add another account I get the following:

Unable to connect

The connection was refused when attempting to contact localhost. 

   The site could be temporarily unavailable or too busy. Try again in a few moments.    If you are unable to load any pages, check your computer’s network connection.    If your computer or network is protected by a firewall or proxy, make sure that Thunderbird is permitted to access the web.

Since the first account works, I assume there is no problem with network connection, firewalls, or proxy settings. I have confirmed spellings of username and password. Any ideas?
